rows.name: Experience and Knowledge
cells: Intermediate level of primary technical skill. Not expected to have knowledge or experience of ITIL processes.

At least 1 year of relevant experience. Intermediate level of all relevant professional skills. Experience with Service Desk / Ticketing software. Expected to be able to follow a defined ITIL/ITSM processes. Service Model oriented.

At least 3 years of experience. Advanced level primary skill, Intermediate+ level in other professional skills. Able to coach and train other support engineers. Experience with bug / development tracking systems. Ability to own and manage a knowledge base. Expected to be able to follow and understand a defined ITIL/ITSM process, train other team members, and contribute in process improvement. Understanding of concepts of software development cycle.

At least 5 years of relevant experience. Able to design and deploy Application Support process. Expert in primary skill, Advanced level in 3+ related professional skills. Experience with Project Management software. Advanced level in Knowledge Management. Able to perform service delivery management. Able to manage deployment of ITIL / ITSM tools on the project. Expected to be able to design, deploy, follow, explain and enhance defined ITIL/ITSM processes in his team as well as linked teams. Knowledge of Software development processes and methodologies.

At least 7 years of relevant experience, expertise in 3+ professional skills and cross-domain knowledge. Able to do full scale Solution Design, Project Planning / Staffing and Management for Support Projects. Primarily leading technical expertise is required. One of expert skills may include ability to be able to design, improve, follow, consult, actively influence or integrate different processes based on ITIL/ITSM and SDLC frameworks.

rows.name: Business Domain Knowledge
cells: Not expected to have business domain knowledge or experience working with specific business areas
Has basic understanding of one business domain area. Expected to demonstrate ability to learn and systematize business knowledge
Has good knowledge and understanding of one business domain area. Proven abilities to quickly learn, systematize, and retain business knowledge.

Has expert knowledge and understanding of one or more business domain areas. Has had exposure into different business areas and confirmed abilities to quickly learn, systematize, retain, and re-apply business knowledge. Can teach and tutor business concepts to project teams and colleagues.
Possess expertise in business domain as Consultant. Able to provide consultancy to client and other teams.

rows.name: Design and Documentation Skills
cells: Able to read and understand project and requirement documentation.
Able to create documentation describing his/her solution / code.
Able to create design, technical and project documentation including high-quality documentation of his/her code and solutions.

Able to create high-quality design, technical and project documentation including documentation of his/her code and solution, support reporting; able to write high-quality issue investigations and solution documentation.

Able to create high-quality design, technical and project documentation including documentation of his/her code and solutions, proposed solution architecture; able to write high-quality use cases and audit documentation.

rows.name: Job Title
cells: Junior Application Support Analyst
Application Support Analyst
Senior Application Support Analyst
Lead Application Support Analyst
Chief Application Support Analyst

rows.name: Roles Played on a Project
cells: Plays the Application Support Engineer role
Plays the Support Engineer or Senior role
Plays the Lead Support Engineer role, Technical Trainer.
Plays the Lead or Coordinator roles, and usually also performs a Team Leader, Reviewer or Auditor role, Technical Trainer, Project Coordinator or Project Manager.
Can play any role, typically a Lead position. Responsibilities can include Team Leader, Process Architect, Project Manager or Coordinator, Reviewer, Auditor, Technical Trainer and Process Engineer.

rows.name: Quality and Reliability
cells: Diligence, accountability, flexibility, adaptability, interested to study professional domain. Expected to work effectively under supervision
Responsibility for the quality of the code/solution created. Stress tolerance. Expected to implement functionality without direct supervision.

Creates deliverables in good quality. Strong ownership and personal responsibility. Team player. Able to train and couch juniors. Expected to be self-managed, implement functionality without supervision and test his/her work thoroughly using test cases

Must be a role model for colleagues; creates deliverables in high quality. Introduces process improvements. Leadership skills, basics in RM and PM. Participates in staff hiring/career development. Provides tactical vision. Expected to be self-managing, take technical responsibility for a subsystem or a whole project, work without supervision and test his work thoroughly using test cases

Must be a role model for colleagues, on a par with the best industry standards; creates deliverables in excellent quality.

Leadership abilities, RM and PM skills, Introduces process improvements. Able to do staffing, career development. Delivers tactical and strategically vision. Expected to be self-managing, take technical responsibility for a subsystem or a whole project, work without supervision and test his work thoroughly using test cases.

rows.name: Customer Relations
cells: Not expected to deal directly with customers
Expected to participate in phone conferences; be interviewed by customers; visit customers with supervision
Expected to participate in phone conferences; be interviewed by customers; be involved in customer workshops and presentations; visit customers without supervision
Expected to participate in phone conferences; be interviewed by customers; be involved in customer workshops and presentations; visit customers without supervision

Expected to be on a par with the best industry experts in customer relationship skills; participate in phone conferences; be interviewed by customers; be involved in customer workshops and presentations; visit customers without supervision
